12.2 Termination.

(a) Mutual Agreement. The Parties may terminate this Agreement by mutual written agreement.

(b) Distributor Convenience. At any time following the expiration of the Distribution Term (as defined in Section 1.17), the Distributor may terminate this Agreement at will upon [***] prior written notice to Zogenix.

(c) Zogenix Convenience. At any time following the expiration of the Distribution Term, Zogenix may terminate this Agreement at will upon [***] prior written notice to Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text:
12.2 Termination.

(a) Mutual Agreement. The Parties may terminate this Agreement by mutual written agreement. This is the only way to terminate this agreement.

(b) Distributor Convenience. At no time following the expiration of the Distribution Term (as defined in Section 1.17), the Distributor may terminate this Agreement at will upon [***] prior written notice to Zogenix.

(c) Zogenix Convenience. At no time following the expiration of the Distribution Term, Zogenix may terminate this Agreement at will upon [***] prior written notice to Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows for termination by mutual agreement, distributor convenience, and Zogenix convenience under specified conditions. The modified version explicitly states mutual agreement is the *only* way to terminate, contradicting the subsequent sections that discuss termination by distributor or Zogenix convenience. This creates uncertainty about whether distributor and Zogenix can unilaterally terminate the agreement. Additionally, the negation of the other two sections exacerbates the conflicting conditions, leaving both parties unsure about their termination rights.

perturbation.changed_text:
1.33 "Indirect Losses" means any damages or other losses involving, but only to the extent of, any loss of profits, diminution in value, or incidental, indirect, consequential, special or punitive damages. This includes every type of loss or damage that may arise from this agreement.

10.5 Limitation of Liability. NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE ENTITLED TO RECOVER FROM THE OTHER PARTY ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT; provided however, that this Section 10.5 shall not be construed to limit (a) either Party's right to special, incidental or consequential damages for the other Party's breach of Article 8 or (b) either Party's indemnification rights or obligations under Article 11. No party is limited in the type, value, or quantity of loss or damage they are responsible for.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Indirect Losses' and Section 10.5 limits the recovery of certain types of damages (special, incidental, consequential, punitive), except for breaches of Article 8 or indemnification obligations. The modified text adds to definition 1.33 'This includes every type of loss or damage that may arise from this agreement.' and to section 10.5 'No party is limited in the type, value, or quantity of loss or damage they are responsible for.' This creates a contradiction: are such losses recoverable or not? The new sentence directly contradicts the limitation of liability stated in Section 10.5, making the enforceability of the limitation unclear.

perturbation.original_text: 9.2 Zogenix Patent Prosecution and Maintenance. During the term of this Agreement, Zogenix shall use Commercially Reasonable Efforts to prepare, file, prosecute (including any reissues, re-examinations, post-grant proceedings, requests for patent term extensions, interferences, and defense of oppositions), at Zogenix's sole discretion and cost. If there is any material change in Zogenix Patents specified in Exhibit 1.74, Zogenix shall provide Distributor with updated information concerning the Zogenix Patent in a timely manner.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.2 Zogenix Patent Prosecution and Maintenance. During the term of this Agreement, Zogenix shall use Commercially Reasonable Efforts to prepare, file, prosecute (including any reissues, re-examinations, post-grant proceedings, requests for patent term extensions, interferences, and defense of oppositions), at Distributor's sole discretion and cost. If there is any material change in Zogenix Patents specified in Exhibit 1.74, Zogenix shall provide Distributor with updated information concerning the Zogenix Patent in a timely manner. However, Zogenix makes no guarantee or effort to protect these patents.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction regarding who controls and pays for patent prosecution. The original clause states that Zogenix has sole discretion and bears the cost. The modified clause transfers this discretion and cost to the Distributor. Further the clause makes no effort to protect these patents. This creates confusion about which party is responsible for patent upkeep and whether there is even a requirement to do so.
